sentences.en: "Our marriage was a mistake," she said, looking rueful.
sentences.cn: “我们的婚姻是个错误，”她说着，看起来懊悔不已。

sentences.en: Ellen gave me a rueful smile.
He made a blank and rueful face when he saw Mr. Arthur seated upon a table.
sentences.cn: 他看见亚瑟先生高踞在桌子上,不觉一愣,露出了无可奈何的伤心脸色.

sentences.en: He seemed both rueful and fatalistic about his prospective eminence.
sentences.cn: 他对自己将担任的要职,似乎抱着一种既郁郁不乐,又听天由命的情绪.

sentences.en: He shook his head and gave me a rueful smile.
sentences.cn: 他摇了摇头，遗憾地对我笑了笑。

sentences.en: He thought of her with a rueful smile.
He was rueful for joining the army.
Hung - chien , with a rueful smile , had no choice but to take the child.
sentences.cn: 鸿 渐 无可奈何, 苦笑接过来.

sentences.en: Lord Mountdrago smiled, but the smile that tried to be careless was only rueful.
sentences.cn: 芒德内哥勋爵笑了笑, 他原想表现得若无其事,结果却露出了一副苦笑.

sentences.en: Mary Ann shot him a rueful look.
sentences.cn: 玛丽·安懊悔地瞥了他一眼。

sentences.en: She could not help laughing at his rueful countenance.
sentences.cn: 她看他愁眉苦脸,忍不住笑起来.

sentences.en: She managed a rueful little smile.
sentences.cn: 她勉强露出颇带惆怅的一丝笑容.

sentences.en: The play is a rueful, wry observation about the way we are all subject to the ravages of time.
sentences.cn: 该剧凄然而讽刺地描述了我们大家是如何被岁月所摧残的。

trans.tran_cn: 后悔的，悔恨的，悲伤的，可怜的
trans.tran_en: feeling or showing that you wish you had not done something
